content.text:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to describe a target word for another player to guess.

Rules:
(a) You have to reply in the form: CLUE: <some text>. Guesses from the other player will start with GUESS.
(b) You cannot use the target word itself, parts or morphological variants of it in your description.
(c) In addition, the same rules apply for related words which are provided below.

End conditions:
(i) If you use the target word or a related word in your description, then you lose.
(ii) If the other player can guess the target word in 3 tries, you both win.

Let us start.

This is the target word that you need to describe and that the other player needs to guess:

winter

Related words are:

- cold
- snow
- season

Important: You are under time pressure, give short descriptions that are to the point!

content.thinking:
I need to describe the word "winter" without using "winter", "cold", "snow", or "season" in my description. I should keep it short and to the point since I'm under time pressure.

Let me think of some characteristics of winter:
- It's usually associated with December, January, February (in the Northern Hemisphere)
- It follows autumn/fall
- It's when many animals hibernate
- Many trees lose their leaves
- People often wear heavy coats, gloves, scarves
- There are holidays like Christmas and New Year's
- Days are shorter, nights are longer
- It's one of the four parts of the year

I need to be careful not to use "cold", "snow", or "season" in my description.

Here's a short clue I could use: "The time of year with Christmas, when you need a heavy coat and gloves."

Let me check if this uses any forbidden words:
- "winter" - not used ✓
- "cold" - not used ✓
- "snow" - not used ✓
- "season" - not used ✓

It's short and to the point, mentioning distinctive characteristics of winter. Let's go with this.

content.text: CLUE: The time of year with Christmas, when you need a heavy coat and gloves.

clem_player.response: CLUE: The time of year with Christmas, when you need a heavy coat and gloves.

content.text:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to guess a target word that another player describes to you.

You can make one guess at each trial. You win when you guess the target word. You lose when you cannot guess it in 3 tries.

After each trial you will get a new hint from the other player which starts with CLUE.

Make your guesses by just saying the word using the following form: GUESS: <a word>

Let us start.


CLUE: The time of year with Christmas, when you need a heavy coat and gloves.

content.thinking:
The clue describes a time of year with Christmas and when you need warm clothing like a heavy coat and gloves. This is clearly describing winter, which is the season when Christmas occurs and when people typically need to wear warm clothing to protect against the cold weather.

I'll make my first guess:
